intro: Hoya unica, commonly known as the Waffle Plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its waxy, thick leaves that resemble a waffle pattern. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Hoya unica is a trailing plant that thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. It is popular among houseplant enthusiasts for its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
